intro: Amsinckia mollis, commonly known as the softleaf fennel, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Amsinckia mollis is a perennial herb that can grow up to 2 meters tall, with a taproot system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. Its seeds are small and dry, and they are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
